title: Yemeni Clerics Threaten 'Jihad' Against Foreign Military Intervention
full text:
(RTTNews) - More than 150 Yemeni Muslim clerics and Islamist leaders have threatened to declare 'Jihad,' (holy war) if any foreign troops entered the Arab country to fight al-Qaeda.
Yemen's council of clerics met Thursday in a mosque in capital Sanaa was presided over by Sheikh Abdul-Majeed al-Zindani, who is wanted by the United States over terrorism funding charges.
In a statement issued after the conclave, the clerics said: "It is a duty to resort to Jihad if the country is invaded by foreign troops."
Addressing a press conference, al-Zindani said: "If any party insists on aggression, or invades the country, then according to Islam, Jihad (holy war) becomes obligatory." He is also believed to be a spiritual leader to terror mastermind Osama bin Laden.
Despite being Yemen's ally in the fight against terrorism, the Obama administration recently ruled out deploying US ground forces to the militancy-hit Gulf country.
But on Wednesday, senior US Senator Carl Levin called upon Washington to consider drone attacks against al-Qaeda extremists in Yemen.
The Democrat lawmaker from Michigan urged airstrikes, undercover operations, and increased US military aid to Sana'a as options that Washington should consider in dealing with the "threat from al-Qaeda militants" in Yemen.
